Find the equivalent resistance Req of R2 and R3 using the formula 1/Req = 1/R2 + 1/R3.

Calculate the main circuit current I using Ohm's Law: I = E / (Rtotal + r) = 6V / (4Ω + 2Ω) = 6V / 6Ω = 1A.
The main circuit current I is 1A.
Find the voltage across R1 using Ohm's Law: U1 = I × R1 = 1A × 2Ω = 2V.
The voltage across R1, U1, is 2V.

Calculate the charge Q stored on the capacitor using the formula Q = C × UC = 10μF × 2V = 20μC.
